TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi abstract beforefieldinit MaskDescriptor extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Defines a set of members for derived classes to provide options for the masked text box UI type editor.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Design.MaskDescriptor> abstract class defines the common set of properties that all mask descriptors must implement. You can use mask descriptors to create predefined mask options for use in the UI type editor for the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MaskedTextBox>. For example, [!INCLUDE[vsprvs](~/includes/vsprvs-md.md)] provides predefined masks for data such as the Postal Code, time, different date formats, and telephone number. All predefined masks will be associated with the <xref:System.ComponentModel.MaskedTextProvider> parsing engine.
You can discover <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Design.MaskDescriptor> types at design time by querying the <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.ITypeDiscoveryService> service provider.

remarks.format: ## Remarks <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Design.MaskDescriptor.%23ctor%2A> is a compiler-supplied default constructor. A default constructor is required by the <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.ITypeDiscoveryService> service provider.

Docs.summary: Gets the representing the locale the mask is authored for.
Docs.value: A representing the locale the mask is authored for.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance bool Equals(object maskDescriptor) cil managed

Docs.param: The to compare with the current .
Docs.summary: Determines whether the specified is equal to the current .
Docs.returns: if the specified is equal to the current ; otherwise, .

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Design.MaskDescriptor.Equals%2A> method determines whether `maskDescriptor` and the current mask descriptor describe the same mask.
This method returns `true` if the following conditions are met in both mask descriptors.
1. The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Design.MaskDescriptor.Mask%2A> property is the same for both mask descriptors.
2. The validating type is the same for both mask descriptors.
> [!NOTE] > The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Design.MaskDescriptor.Name%2A> property is not considered, because the <xref:System.ComponentModel.MaskedTextProvider> and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MaskedTextBox> classes do not use it.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public static hidebysig bool IsValidMaskDescriptor(class System.Windows.Forms.Design.MaskDescriptor maskDescriptor) cil managed

Docs.param: The mask descriptor to test for validity.
Docs.summary: Returns a value indicating whether the specified mask descriptor is valid and can be added to the masks list.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Design.MaskDescriptor.IsValidMaskDescriptor%2A> method determines whether `maskDescriptor` is valid and can be added to the masks list.
A valid <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Design.MaskDescriptor> must meet the following conditions.
- Not `null`.
- Not `null` or an empty mask.
- Not `null` or an empty name.
- Not `null` or an empty sample.
- The sample is correct based on the mask and all required edit characters have been provided. This means the mask is completed but not necessarily full.
- The sample is valid based on the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Design.MaskDescriptor.ValidatingType%2A> object, if any.

MemberSignature.Value: public static bool IsValidMaskDescriptor (System.Windows.Forms.Design.MaskDescriptor maskDescriptor, out string validationErrorDescription);
.method public static hidebysig bool IsValidMaskDescriptor(class System.Windows.Forms.Design.MaskDescriptor maskDescriptor, string validationErrorDescription) cil managed

Docs.param: The mask descriptor to test for validity.
A string representing a validation error. If no validation error occurred, the validationErrorDescription is .
Docs.summary: Returns a value indicating whether the specified mask descriptor is valid, and provides an error description if it is not valid.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Design.MaskDescriptor.IsValidMaskDescriptor%2A> method determines whether `maskDescriptor` is valid and can be added to the masks list.
A valid <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Design.MaskDescriptor> must meet the following conditions.
- Not `null`.
- Not `null` or an empty mask.
- Not `null` or an empty name.
- Not `null` or an empty sample.
- The sample is correct based on the mask and all required edit characters have been provided. This means the mask is completed but not necessarily full.
- The sample is valid based on the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Design.MaskDescriptor.ValidatingType%2A> object, if any.

Docs.value: A containing the mask being defined.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The mask must contain only valid characters, as defined by the <xref:System.ComponentModel.MaskedTextProvider.IsValidMaskChar%2A> method of the <xref:System.ComponentModel.MaskedTextProvider> class. When a predefined mask is selected in [!INCLUDE[vsprvs](~/includes/vsprvs-md.md)], its <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Design.MaskDescriptor.Mask%2A> property is displayed.

Docs.summary: Gets the user-friendly name of the mask.
Docs.value: A containing the name or brief description of the .

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Design.MaskDescriptor.Name%2A> property is displayed in the **Mask Description** column in the visual editor for the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MaskedTextBox> control.

Docs.summary: Gets a sample of a formatted string for the mask.
Docs.value: A containing text that is formatted by using the .

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Design.MaskDescriptor.Sample%2A> property is displayed in the **Data Format** column in the visual editor for the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MaskedTextBox> control.

Docs.summary: Gets the type providing validation associated with the mask.
Docs.value: The that the formatted string is validated against.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Design.MaskDescriptor.ValidatingType%2A> property is used to validate the input string after the mask has been applied to it. It directly corresponds to the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MaskedTextBox.ValidatingType%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MaskedTextBox> class.
